bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Josiah Child, 9 June 1879
bibl.orgName: The location of the original manuscript is unknown. Miller's transcription is derived from a transcript provided by Mrs. Pearl Stone.

body.p: I have only just rec'dreceived yours of April 22d, with $24.50 from Trübner & Co. for which am'tamount see receipt enclosed—

I note the order for nineteen new copies, & as soon as I go back to Camden, (within a week) they shall be carefully forwarded to you. You speak of a remittance for of three guineas, promised to be forwarded by Mr. Fraser for the Tobacco Plant piece. As no such remittance has been rec'dreceived by me, nor heard about, it has probably been deferred—Mr. F. can address me, & send P O order to Camden—I shall prepare other two pieces & send him for the paper, in response to his kind request.

Thanks for letter enclosures—Mr. Westness's, Mr Walters's & Mr Norman's. Will try to send you photos for him (Thos:Thomas Dixon's is not enclosed)—I keep well, for me—have been away from home gallivanting around, land & water, & especially this city, the last two months—I send you a paper with this.

postscript.p: (I write this from New York City, U S A. 1309 Fifth av:avenue near 86th st.street: but I return soon to 431 Stevens st:street Camden New Jersey—which is my permanent P O address—)
